title: Here's everything coming to Amazon's Prime Video in April 2022
text:
The supernatural thriller “Outer Range” (April 22) looks to be the most intriguing offering of the month, starring Josh Brolin as a Wyoming rancher who discovers a very literal metaphysical void on his land. Is it a dimensional portal? A UFO? Something mystical? Maybe all of the above?

There's also the British comedy thriller series “The Outlaws” (April 1), starring Christopher Walken and Stephen Merchant, and centered around a group of lawbreakers thrown together to perform community service; “All the Old Knives” (April 8), a spy movie starring Chris Pine and Thandiwe Newton about a CIA operative trying to expose a mole; and the acclaimed, genre-bending animated series “Undone,” which returns for its second season April 29.

Also: What's coming in April to Netflix | HBO Max | Hulu

More: What's worth streaming in April 2022 — and why Apple, HBO Max, Netflix are the must-haves

And for those missing Netflix's “The Crown,” there's Season 2 of “A Very British Scandal” (April 22), starring Claire Foy and Paul Bettany as real-life British royals going through a very public divorce (gasp!) in the 1960s.

Amazon AMZN will also add a crop of modern movie classics, such as “Cast Away,” “Rushmore,” “Young Frankenstein,” “Dirty Dancing,” “Bull Durham” and “Raging Bull.”

Here's the complete list of what's coming in April 22, as of March 27 (release dates are subject to change):
